description: Super moist, great for afternoon tea with a cup of coffee or tea.
keywords: Banana bread,Pescatarian,Seafood free,Soy free,Vegetarian,Tree nut free,Sesame free,Peanut free
name: Easy Choc-chip Banana Bread Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 cup milk or dark choc chip

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 150 degrees Celsius fan-forced oven. Grease a 7cm deep, 12cm x 20cm loaf tin, lining base and the 2 long sides with baking paper to overhang 2 cm above edge of tin on the long sides.

Sift flour, bi carb soda, and cinnamon into a large bowl and stir in the brown sugar. Whisk the eggs, the milk and vanilla essence in a small glass jug or small bowl. Add the milk mixture, the butter and the mashed banana to the flour mixture along with the choc chips and fold through.

Pour or spoon batter into prepared tin, smooth the surface and sprinkle a few choc chips on top of the batter, as they tend to sink to the bottom of the cake. Bake for 1 hour. Test cake with metal skewer. Cake is done when skewer comes out clean.
Remove cake from oven and let cake cool in the tin for 10 minutes then turn onto a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 3 days.
